Posts.Title: Worried single mother of 10yo boy.. 2good2btrue 2good2btrue

Posts.Content: 2good2btrue wrote: I've had a nipple oriented nodule that has recently increased in size.  My naturopath tested me and picked up cancer...possibly early stage. Had a mammogram, ultrasound, and thermal imaging done in one day !!  The thermal imaging showed increased heat areas which suggest inflammatory changes in the right breast as well as other known conditions I have.  I was called back by the Medical clinic for my results, which made me panic.....The mammo was clear, but the ultrasound showed.... "A somewhat irregular shaped hypoechoic and vascularised nodule measuring 8.7 x 5.0 x 4.4mm.  There is some suggestion that this is interrupting the tissue planes.  U/S guided FNA or core biospy of the lesion would be appropiate. " I will be having the biopsy on Wed 24th April at the Olivia Newton John cancer and wellness clinic in Melbourne, Australia.. Any opinions are greatly needed here as I am googling and it doesn't sound too positive... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worried single mother of 10yo boy.. 2good2btrue 2good2btrue

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2013 12:16AM 2good2btrue wrote: Ariom and Chrissy...Thanks so much for your advice, and you are right...I need to stop looking for answers on the internet, and wait for a diagnostic result...(More waiting again)...My sister has been 5 yrs cancer free after her diagnosis and mastectomy.  She is older than me, and has been a wonderful inspiration.  So we do also have a family history.  I pray and hope that all this worrying is for nothing....but my gut tells me otherwise and I also feel its ok to be prepared for the worst scenario as well.  I hate surprises...  Either way, it's all about "living" with cancer; not "dying" with cancer... Glad I found this blog, and know I'll be ok.  God bless to all...Will keep you updated... PS..Does being pre-menstrual or having your period during a biopsy make any difference to the findings??
